api-functions.title: Build an API Function Library
api-functions.description: Create a reusable function library with proper signatures, type hints, and flexible parameters

automation-script.title: Build an Automation Script
automation-script.description: Create a batch processing script that iterates through data, applies transformations, and generates reports

calculator-app.title: Build a Calculator
calculator-app.description: Build a calculator application that handles arithmetic, comparisons, type conversions, and input validation

collection-cli-app.title: Build a CLI Collection App
collection-cli-app.description: Build a complete command-line application from scratch - create storage, get user input, display items, add validation, and save your data to files.

data-processor.title: Build a Data Processor
data-processor.description: Build a log parsing and data cleaning pipeline that reads, transforms, and aggregates data

data-store.title: Build a Data Store
data-store.description: Create an in-memory data store with lists, dictionaries, sets and proper data management

data-transformer.title: Build a Data Transformer
data-transformer.description: Create efficient data transformation pipelines using comprehensions and generators

error-handler.title: Build an Error Handler
error-handler.description: Create robust error handling with try/except, custom exceptions, and cleanup logic

file-manager.title: Build a File Manager
file-manager.description: Create a file management utility with reading, writing, path handling, and proper resource management

form-validator.title: Build a Form Validator
form-validator.description: Create validation logic for user input with conditional checks, pattern matching, and error handling

module-library.title: Build a Reusable Module
module-library.description: Design a well-structured, reusable Python module with clean APIs, data models, and robust error handling

oop-entity.title: Build an OOP Entity System
oop-entity.description: Build a class hierarchy with inheritance, properties, and class methods to model entities

python-basics.title: Build Your First Python Script
python-basics.description: Learn Python fundamentals from variables to imports while building a simple interactive script

text-adventure.title: Build a Text Adventure Game
text-adventure.description: Create an interactive text-based adventure with player state, inventory, commands, and game logic

text-formatter.title: Build a Text Formatter
text-formatter.description: Create a text processing utility that cleans, transforms, and formats user input

contexts.list-create-empty: Start with an empty shopping cart for the user.
contexts.list-create-values: Initialize cart with previously saved items.
contexts.tuple-create: Store immutable product info like (sku, category).
contexts.list-append-dynamic: Add an item the customer wants to buy.
contexts.list-extend-method: Add multiple items from a saved cart.
contexts.list-insert-dynamic: Insert item at a specific position.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if an item is already in the cart before adding.
contexts.list-count: Count how many of this item are in the cart.
contexts.list-index: Find the position of an item in the cart.
contexts.dict-create-values: Track item details like quantity and price.
contexts.dict-create-empty: Create an empty price lookup dictionary.
contexts.dict-set-item: Update the quantity of an item.
contexts.input-string: Get the product name from the customer.
contexts.for-loop-list: Display all items in the cart.
contexts.for-loop-string: Display each character of product name.
contexts.enumerate-basic: Number items so the user can remove by number.
contexts.sorted-reverse: Get items sorted by price, highest first.
contexts.list-comp-filter-dynamic: Show only items above a certain price.
contexts.list-comp-conditional: Get items that are on sale.
contexts.if-else-basic: Check if customer has enough credit.
contexts.boolean-and: Check if item is in stock AND affordable.
contexts.boolean-or: Check if item is on sale OR clearance.
contexts.elif-grade: Apply discount tier: gold, silver, bronze.
contexts.except-multi: Handle both stock and payment errors.
contexts.try-else: Run code only if checkout succeeded.
contexts.finally-basic: Always release cart lock after checkout.
contexts.define-function: Create a function to calculate cart total.
contexts.return-none: Return None when item is removed.
contexts.context-intro: Save the cart to resume shopping later.
contexts.pathlib-intro: Use Path for cart file management.
contexts.main-guard-basic: Only run checkout when executed directly.

contexts.if-statement: Check if the field has a value.
contexts.if-membership: Check if input is in allowed values.
contexts.if-not-condition: Check if field is NOT empty.
contexts.match-case-tuple: Match field name and value together.

contexts.list-create-empty: Every task manager needs somewhere to store tasks.
contexts.list-create-values: Initialize the task list with some default tasks.
contexts.tuple-create: Store immutable task metadata like creation date.
contexts.list-append-dynamic: Add a new task the user typed in.
contexts.list-extend-method: Import multiple tasks from another list.
contexts.list-insert-dynamic: Insert a task at a specific priority position.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if a task already exists before adding it.
contexts.list-count: Count how many times a task appears in the list.
contexts.list-index: Find the position of a specific task.
contexts.dict-create-values: Tasks need more than just a name - add status too.
contexts.dict-create-empty: Start with an empty task dictionary.
contexts.dict-get-default: Get task status, defaulting to 'pending' if not found.
contexts.input-string: Get the task description from the user.
contexts.print-string: Display a message to the user.
contexts.print-variable: Show the current task to the user.
contexts.for-loop-list: Display all tasks so the user can see what's pending.
contexts.for-loop-string: Display each character in the task description.
contexts.enumerate-basic: Number the tasks so users can reference them.
contexts.enumerate-start: Number tasks starting from 1 instead of 0.
contexts.zip-basic: Combine task names with their status values.
contexts.f-string-basic: Format task display with name and status.
contexts.f-string-expression: Format task output with calculated values.
contexts.string-format: Format task descriptions using template strings.
contexts.list-sort: Sort tasks in place by priority.
contexts.list-reverse: Show tasks in reverse order, newest first.
contexts.sorted-reverse: Get tasks sorted in reverse order.
contexts.list-comp-basic: Extract just the task titles into a new list.
contexts.list-comp-conditional: Filter tasks based on their completion status.
contexts.if-else-basic: Check if a task is marked as complete.
contexts.if-only: Check if the task list is empty.
contexts.boolean-and: Check if task is urgent AND incomplete.
contexts.boolean-or: Check if task is overdue OR high priority.
contexts.elif-grade: Categorize tasks by priority: high, medium, or low.
contexts.match-case-basic: Handle different task commands with pattern matching.
contexts.try-except-basic: Handle errors when accessing task data.
contexts.raise-intro: Raise an error for invalid task operations.
contexts.raise-exception: Raise ValueError when task not found.
contexts.except-specific: Catch KeyError when task doesn't exist.
contexts.except-multi: Handle multiple possible errors in task operations.
contexts.try-else: Run code only if task operation succeeded.
contexts.finally-basic: Always save task state, even after errors.
contexts.reraise: Re-raise an exception after logging the error.
contexts.define-function: Create a function to add a new task.
contexts.return-none: Return None when task deletion succeeds.
contexts.default-param-simple: Add a task with default priority 'medium'.
contexts.default-param-intro: Define optional parameters for task creation.
contexts.context-intro: Save tasks to a file so they persist between sessions.
contexts.file-open-write: Write tasks to a file for persistence.
contexts.file-read-lines: Load tasks from a saved file.
contexts.pathlib-intro: Use Path objects to manage task files.
contexts.pathlib-check-exists: Check if the tasks file exists.
contexts.pathlib-create-path: Create a path to the tasks data directory.
contexts.pathlib-join-paths: Join paths for task archive files.
contexts.main-guard-basic: Only run task CLI when executed directly.
contexts.import-from: Import utility functions for task handling.
